result.execSummary:
Taylor Brentford was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Taylor Brentford was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Taylor Brentford

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Taylor Brentford in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Taylor Brentford in custody.  Kimberly D. Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case called on today's calendar at request of defense counsel.  The court date of 4/10/14 is vacated; defense counsel advised his client does not wish to contest extradition.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of Ohio.  Defendant waived extradition hearing and consents to extradition.  Signed Waiver of Extradition received and filed.  Court ordered the defendant remanded into custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department and awaiting pick up by the State of Ohio  The Court was advised of the pending House of Correction sentence.  Courts orders case closed.

Defendant Taylor Brentford in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Taylor Brentford in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of Ohio.  Defendant advised he wanted to waive extradition, however, due to the questions regarding pickup by the State of Ohio, Court would not accept waiver.  Court finds Defendant contested extradition.  Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Status conference scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Taylor Brentford
Current: 1220 W Vliet Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 03-11-2014)
Prior: 2406 N 38th St, Milwaukee, WI 53210
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
